Title: Cooking with Chaucer, Hildegard of Bingen, Shakespeare, and Anne Hathaway. Course Description: 
In this course, we will explore the culinary lives of people in the Middle Ages and the Early Modern period. Drawing from a range of readings, videos, guest speakers, and cooking experiments, we will look at the ways that socioeconomic differences, international trading, religious guidelines, and gender divisions influenced people's diets and appeared in contemporary writing. No prior experience with these authors is expected and students from all disciplines are welcome. Hildegard is included because cooking during these times was closely linked with medicine and she was deeply engaged with such activities, so students wishing to examine (or create) homemade remedies from the period will have that opportunity. Dietary options were changing rapidly due to a rapid increase in the availability of spices and other new food items, but there were also serious problems with food shortages. The material is fascinating and the cooking projects can be geared to individual interests and budgets. The course fulfills the Writing Requirement.
